so our first stop in the province of jujuy 
argentina was the town of purmamarca whose name

translates to desert city in the aymara language 
this is a pretty quiet town lined with adobe

buildings ancient algarvo trees a lively market 
that sets up in the central square and we can't

forget the otherworldly rainbow colored 
mountains that act as a beautiful backdrop

well good morning everyone and greetings from

i wasn't cutting it no i wasn't cutting it 
it doesn't cover your face the wind blows it

it has a strap so the wind is not gonna blow it

on the earth you've got like oranges and lavender

let's keep going let's do it this spot right here

climb that you can access from the center of town 
there's a very small fee of just a few pesos and

you get some really great views of the famous hill 
of seven colors it's well worth the short climb

we then made our way to the square known

one more thing i already showed you my candy my

one and now we're just sitting in front of the the 
church here in front of the town square the church

dates back to 1648 it's made out of adobe 
no photos allowed inside but we'll show you

the exterior so you get an idea of what it's like 
our visit to purmamarca jujuy argentina was short

and sweet because we still had a steep mountain 
pass to cross we got back in the car and started

the drive to salinas grandes a massive salt flat 
situated between the provinces of huhui and salta

well guys a little update from the back of the car 
here we've been climbing up mountains and hills

now for about 40 minutes 30 or 40 minutes it's 
about 60 kilometers from the town we were visiting

is a place called the salinas grandes basically 
the giant salt flats we've been climbing up

these meandering roads with just amazing views 
like just unbelievable views along the way and

it's very serpentine roads we're taking it easy 
we're sucking on our cocoa candy in the back here

and we're trying to acclimatize 
as best we can to the altitude

on the drive over we came across a herd of 
guanacos they're a close relative of the llama

and they kind of blend in with the landscape 
so we were pretty excited to see them

time for another update from the road we have 
made it to our maximum altitude today four

thousand one hundred and seventy meters above sea 
level here in altos el morado how are you feeling

let's hope not like that i mean i'm starting 
to feel like a pressure on my head and like

a heaviness so we just stopped here at a lookout 
we snapped some photos but there was also a lady

selling more coca candy because apparently someone 
in the back has already almost finished the first

pack we had to grab a few more packs for the 
rest of the day and tomorrow so yeah frankly

you feel like crap up here yeah let's put it 
you know let's take it put it the right way

and a lot of people feel worse than others yeah 
so why because it's so fast you know it's uh

you'll never know how how you're going to feel 
until you experience it yeah and you climb to

this altitude some people are i don't know they 
have a metabolism that is uh it does not affect

them as much i'm i'm not i'm not worried but some 
other ones they it feels like your body turns to

rubber yeah and your head is very light-headed you 
just feel lethargic yeah it's uh it's a very uh

ugly sensation let's let's say but on the bright 
side on the bright side we can already see the

salt flats we're only 20 minutes away so it wasn't 
that long of a journey and we're going down and

we're going down we are descending again on the 
other side of the mountain so things are improving

this is salinas grandes a vast white desert 
of salt that sits at an altitude of 3 450

meters above sea level it's a cool place to snap 
some photos and have fun with optical illusions

well guys we have made it to salinas grandes the 
great salt flats here in jujuy argentina it was a

bit of an optical illusion almost like a mirage on 
approach yeah it looked like water water yeah yeah

we could see from the far away from the distance 
it looked like a lake instead of a salt flat

so yeah it's nice here and over there there is 
a whole bunch of rows of pools where they uh

i guess that's where they get the salt from you 
know the only thing is that you can really feel

the sun here you know the the sun rays they

and it feels like it's really uh 
you're cooking cooking here you know

bronzing getting some color there are steaks on

because uh you could end up 
roasted the chicken you know yeah

also sorry about the abrupt ending to this 
vlog i accidentally filmed the speaking outro

in slow motion classic and then i thought i 
lost my cell phone so we spent a good chunk

of time retracing our steps looking for it in 
the desert of course it made an appearance in

the door panel we had already searched three 
times so yeah it was a bit of a stressful end

to the day but we'll see you in the next video 
where we'll visit the towns of ukiya and uma
and also a high altitude vineyard so see you soon
